name: Hairless Cat Painting
description:
This unique piece was painted live at a charity event in Los Angeles, and is full of fun and energy.  Part of the ongoing "Captured" series, in which I utilize freedom and color to capture the essence of various animals.  Many people responded to the piece as it was developing, and I know that there is a cat lover out there that will appreciate having the energy of this piece in their home.

This is a rare occasion in which the work is available directly from me vs through a gallery.

30x40"
Acrylic on Canvas

name: Hand Cut Wood Bunny Rabbit 16
description:
Each of these bunnies are hand drawn on half inch plywood, and hand cut with a jig saw.  Each one is unique and one of a kind, yet part of a growing tribe.  I started making these a couple years ago in Spain, and since then they have become my most requested item.  Generally, they have been sold through galleries in Los Angeles, but this is the first time they are available directly from me.

They are rigged to either stand on a shelf or table via a built in kickstand, or to be mounted flat on a wall.  Each is signed and dated on the back with a brush.

To see a fun album of some of the bunnies in Japan:
https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.374308872662505.86512.248343875259006&type=3

name: Model One
description:
This is a print of an original 6' x 6' painting that was featured and sold in the New Tongues show at Cave Gallery 2013.

It is a still life of a vintage Remington Model One typewriter that I found in a thrift store. The keys are embellished with mysterious lettering. 

Model One
18x18 inches
Printed on 300 gsm archival cotton rag
Limited edition of 50
Signed and numbered by the artist

name: Bell System
description:
This is a print of an original 36" x 36" painting that was featured and sold in the New Tongues show at Cave Gallery.

It is a still life of a vintage Bell System phone that I found.  Notice the mysterious lettering.  Where could it be from?

Bell System
18x18 inches
Printed on 300 gsm archival cotton rag
Limited edition of 50
Signed and numbered by the artist

name: Lost and Found
description:
This is a print of a painting that has a story.  I was painting the original at Cave Gallery last year.  At the end of the night I packed up my car, but failed to pack up the painting.  I drove home leaving it in the street.  When I discovered what I had done, I drove back out to the gallery, but the painting was long gone.  I thought it was lost forever.

Eight months later, I was tagged in a photo on Facebook.  It was the painting!  It turned out that a woman had found it lying in the street.  She brought it home and hung it above her fireplace.  Eventually someone came to her house that recognized the work and let her know I was the artist (I had not signed it yet).

When I contacted her about it, she said she was glad that she found me becuase she was moving to Austin and she was unable to take the painting with her.  I rescued it from her, finished it, and brought it to Cave Gallery where it was originally slated to show more than a year ago.  It has finally completed it's journey.

Lost and Found
18 x 24 Inches
Printed on 300 gsm archival cotton rag
Signed and numbered by the artist
Edition of 50

name: Native America
description:
The original that this hand pulled screen print is based on was painted at a Tee Pee Records showcase, July 4th, 2009.  It sold immediately and I have been getting requests to release a print ever since.  HERE IT IS!  A proud and fierce Native American set against an American flag. 

24x18"
Hand signed in brush and ink and numbered in pencil.  
Limited edition of 100.

name: Multi Color Skull
description:
Power Without Conscience - Multi Color Skull Print

These prints are hand embellished limited editions.  Each one is hand colored by yours truly, making each one unique.  They are signed in white with a brush, and numbered in pencil.    If you purchase one, we will send you the next numbered print available.


Edition of 30
18"x24"
Hand embellished screen print
Printed on acid free heavy weight cold pressed paper

name: Ganesha SOLD OUT
description:
This print is sold out.

The original image for this print was painted during my 2010 India tour.  Although I'm not a religious man, I often found myself thanking Ganesha for our safe passage though India...

Ganesha

18x24inches

Limited edition of 25

Signed and numbered by the artist

name: Only You
description:
This high quality print was produced using the finest inks and paper, resulting in stunning color and detail.  The subtleties of the original 9 foot wide painting are captured almost miraculously in this 10x20 inch limited edition.  

To view the making of the original epic painting,
CLICK HERE TO SEE THE VIDEO:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eU_o2x_eaYU

"Only You"

10 x 20 in.

limited edition of 100

Signed and numbered by the artist

The original painting has been sold.

name: A Cause to Understand
description:
AKA Panda Guru.  I painted him live in Hollywood a couple years ago.  The original is sold.

The feathers keep him rooted in nature.  The boomboxes open the path to music and technology.  The right hand with two fingers up represents him and the viewer, the two that exist within each others gaze.  And the ice cream is his treat becuase it is a food that forces you to enjoy the moment.  And it's tasty.

Different paintings put off different vibes, and I feel like this one has always been friendly.  He's a good guy to have around the house.


A Cause To Understand

11x14 inches

Limited edition of 100

Signed and numbered by the artist
